posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Those are both the same address/port, David.

I was hoping to help introduce some facts of this server with some goog time but ended up pretty much shooting blanks.  Sorry, but I can't really expand on this subject.

It's a tough server to find any information about, nothing current anyway.  Apparently, it has no web pages, wiki or even any blogs that describe the basics, server status or contact information.  I assume this sort of information can be downloaded in some way when you create a new account there. The only information I could scrape together is from a server list site that could be (probably is) out-of-date.  But here is a paste-over anyway:

Tornado of Souls - PW Action module created by Kell (Mirent Tusk I&II).

ToS has been upgraded to Boware patch 1.69 and CEP 2.1. Custom spells. Customized feats. 40+ Subraces to choose from! Legendary Levels 41-60! Come explore an eye appealing well balanced world. Help defeat the evil that threatens the Prime Material Realm itself! Expansion version available late Decemeber. CEP2.1 and Latest Bio Patches required. Custom spells HAK optional. http://tornadoofsouls.com/

IP:port - --> 216.170.41.45:5121

At least it seems to use some version of the CEP and the latest v1.69 rebuild. I don't understand how a Hak that effects game mechanics could be "optional" but as I stated, this is old data.  The site address posted takes you to the proverbial "Server Not Found" page and I suspect the connection address is just as likely worthless.  I believe the server is based in California, but even that is based on very old postings.  This server goes way back to when the IGN Vault was a blur of activity with news releases about it and such.  Nothing transferred onto the Neverwinter Vault, unfortunately.

Now, if David could fill in some of the gaps and describe the key customizations and requirements, some interest could be drummed up.

posts.author: KidMiracleman
posts.content:
I will try to fill in as much gaps as I can. I am not sure what you mean by key customizations and requirements but as far as I know the only requirements
​is to have Neverwinter Nights and CEP 2.3 or better. 
​I do know that dev crit has been disable but I believe there is a rare weapon that a sub boss drops with dev crit on it.  I have yet to get it to drop
​It is a challenge just to get to that point.  Also one needs 20 levels of sorc or wiz before taking one level of Pale Master. 
​I am sure there is something obvious I am over looking.  There is not much activity on this server.  There a few people that still get on.  I would like
​to change that.  Would be nice to get a few more regular players so we can have regular North Bastions runs again.

Let me know if you have any questions

David

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
KidMiracleman wrote:
I will try to fill in as much gaps as I can. I am not sure what you mean by key customizations and requirements but as far as I know the only requirements
​is to have Neverwinter Nights and CEP 2.3 or better.
 I meant modifications of (or new) feats, classes, spells... any aspects of gameplay that a prospective player would want to know about.  Just knowing it requires version 2.3 means I would need to upgrade my own version 2.1 because that is the only one I need to play all the PWs I have up to this point.   So that is important info to disclose.

Sounds like you have no clue about the spells hak that was mentioned in the server summary I found?
​I do know that dev crit has been disable but I believe there is a rare weapon that a sub boss drops with dev crit on it.  I have yet to get it to drop
​It is a challenge just to get to that point.
 It shouldn't matter whether your toon acquires the feat by building it in or as an item property.  If the feat has been disabled, it's disabled regardless of the source.  Now, that doesn't stop the designer from enabling it on the creatures themselves, though.  Bosses always have uber properties beyond those a toon can achieve anyway.
Also one needs 20 levels of sorc or wiz before taking one level of Pale Master.
 That's important info.
​I am sure there is something obvious I am over looking.  There is not much activity on this server.  There a few people that still get on.  I would like
​to change that.  Would be nice to get a few more regular players so we can have regular North Bastions runs again.
 
This has been a trademark of many of the older servers... dwindling player base, unfortunately.  It seems to take an active effort of the DMs and admin to keep a PW constantly fresh and secure to recommend it to others.

Since this (ToS) server doesn't seem to have a website or forum of its own, feel free to use this topic to communicate with potential players.  Besides listing what you can learn about the mods, maybe furnish a time slot that you typically log there.  Finding a common, comfortable time period seems to be the main obstacle in scheduling parties.  It may take a while, but you will need to persist.  Seasonally, NWN on-line gaming activity begins to increase again in mid-Fall through the Winter, at least here in the U.S.  Good luck in your quest!

posts.content:

I will try to fill in as much gaps as I can. I am not sure what you mean by key customizations and requirements but as far as I know the only requirements

​I forgot about that.  Special spells that were devolped for this server.  Like create arrow spells for ranger and a nice magic missile type of spell for Paladins.  I believe I do have the hak somewhere

​I do know that dev crit has been disable but I believe there is a rare weapon that a sub boss drops with dev crit on it.  I have yet to get it to drop
​It is a challenge just to get to that point.
 It shouldn't matter whether your toon acquires the feat by building it in or as an item property.  If the feat has been disabled, it's disabled regardless of the source.  Now, that doesn't stop the designer from enabling it on the creatures themselves, though.  Bosses always have uber properties beyond those a toon can achieve anyway.
Also one needs 20 levels of sorc or wiz before taking one level of Pale Master.
 That's important info.
​I am sure there is something obvious I am over looking.  There is not much activity on this server.  There a few people that still get on.  I would like
​to change that.  Would be nice to get a few more regular players so we can have regular North Bastions runs again.
 
This has been a trademark of many of the older servers... dwindling player base, unfortunately.  It seems to take an active effort of the DMs and admin to keep a PW constantly fresh and secure to recommend it to others.

Since this (ToS) server doesn't seem to have a website or forum of its own, feel free to use this topic to communicate with potential players.  Besides listing what you can learn about the mods, maybe furnish a time slot that you typically log there.  Finding a common, comfortable time period seems to be the main obstacle in scheduling parties.  It may take a while, but you will need to persist.  Seasonally, NWN on-line gaming activity begins to increase again in mid-Fall through the Winter, at least here in the U.S.  Good luck in your quest!

​Thank you.  right now my schedule is pretty erratic and I am working long hours.  After my schedule stabilizes I will have a better idea of when I log on.  do know there is a guy in Turkey that logs o.  Not sure when he does log on. 

Thank you for the info and your kindness.  I mean it  :)

David

posts.author: CPkell
posts.content: I was thinking of a time, many years ago, that I spent so much time with NWN.  I was pleased to see that as of a couple years ago Tornado of Souls was still remembered.  Hi, I’m Kell and I created TOS and Mirent Tusk.  I am happy to see I brought some fun to people lives for many years,  best wishes to you all.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hello there, Kell - good to have you on board!

Does your presence herald a re-birth of ToS? If so, are there any details you can disclose?

Cheers

posts.author: CPkell
posts.content:
No, I do not see that happening.  It’s been 15+ years since I’ve been in the Toolset.  I no longer have it on a PC.  I was taking a trip down memory lane and did a quick google search and discovered this site.  

A few years back I made a 5 quest foundry campaign in Neverwinter Online under the Mirent Tusk name that was well received.  I’ve not been on there since though and I believe the player made content is no longer supported.

I have ideas for more development and occasionally search for new tool sets to make them a reality...unfortunately I have not come across another toolset like the Aurora one which offered broad development control in an easy-ish to use manner for someone that is not a “professional” developer with a development team.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
unfortunately I have not come across another toolset like the Aurora one which offered broad development control in an easy-ish to use manner for someone that is not a “professional” developer with a development team. 
And I sincerely, honestly doubt that you ever will.

To put it brutally, just about every Producer and Game Maker has learned from the total debacle that is NWN (and now NWN EE) will never, ever do it again.

Of course, from our perspective, it is not a debacle, of course.  It was THE gift.  But from a Company and Producer's side of the story, it represents a total loss of money - it just kept the payerbase playing.  They were not paying anymore.  Horror!  Disgust!  Don't tell the Shareholders!

Just take a look at how Bethesda is doing it with their games (don't mention EA, can't mention EA, shit, too late!).  Now take a look at loot boxes, pay to win, and all the money grubbing schemes that Companies and Producers have come up with so far - they will never go back to just GIVING their payer-base (yes, I coined that!  It's mine!  ALLLL MINE!) something for free, especially a powerful, easy to use toolset so that they can produce *gasp* FREE content!!!!!

No, they will saddle such with all sorts of clauses, rights you have to give away, payments and gods knows what to anything that even remotely smells like free stuff.  Then it will be of a limited purpose, with bits and pieces that one has to pay for to get more purpose, more scope, and on, and on, and on...

The NWN Toolset was (and is) something that sadly, we will not ever see again.

Just as a btw, Bethesda will soon be rising from its ashes, as it's just been bought by...Microsoft. Oh, hang on, it just got worse, folks...

Cheers
